title: Verbal Ability & Grammar
content:
Verbal Ability

Strong communication skills are essential for interviews and corporate life.

Key Areas:

  • Reading Comprehension: Read the passage first, then the questions. Look for keywords.
  • Sentence Correction: Check for subject-verb agreement, tense consistency, and parallelism.
  • Vocabulary: Learn root words to guess meanings of unknown words.

Common Grammar Rules:

  • Subject-Verb Agreement: 'The list of items is on the desk' (not 'are').
  • Pronoun Agreement: 'Everyone must bring their own lunch' (acceptable in modern usage, strictly 'his/her').

Interview Communication

Be clear, concise, and confident. Avoid filler words like 'um', 'like', 'you know'.
